Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.
        Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing using the following news titles and content. Closely follow how CNBC techcheck chooses context to put into the script, the langauge style and sentence structure. Use the same beginning and ending(including mentioning host Wall-E and Tuesday November 26), and replace CNBC techcheck briefing to 'AI briefing' 
 ""

Response:
Script:
i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for tuesday, november 26th. 

meta is preparing for another round of layoffs as the company seeks ways to streamline operations and focus on its core business model. insiders report that mark zuckerberg is doubling down on his vision for the metaverse despite recent challenges. this move comes as meta aims to bolster its financial position after recent declines in quarterly revenue.

meanwhile, microsoft has announced a strategic partnership with siemens to enhance digital collaboration in industrial sectors. the alliance will focus on integrating ai-driven software solutions to optimize manufacturing processes and increase efficiency. this partnership is part of microsoft's broader effort to expand its reach in the industrial automation market, an area seeing significant growth potential.

in the world of cryptocurrency, bitcoin prices have surged past the $50,000 mark. analysts attribute the climb to growing institutional interest and new market entrants investing in crypto assets as a hedge against increasing global inflation rates. this rally reignites discussions about cryptocurrency's long-term viability as an alternative investment vehicle.

and finally, netflix is gearing up for its biggest content release in history, unveiling plans for over 50 new titles by year's end. the streaming giant is leveraging big data and ai to better tailor its offerings to viewer preferences, a strategy that aims to maintain its competitive edge in the rapidly evolving digital content space.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for tuesday, november 26th.

meta is gearing up for another round of layoffs as the company seeks to streamline its operations and refocus on its core business model. insiders reveal that ceo mark zuckerberg remains committed to his vision for the metaverse, despite recent hurdles. this move is part of meta's strategy to strengthen its financial standing following declines in quarterly revenue.

turning to microsoft, the tech giant has announced a strategic partnership with siemens to boost digital collaboration in industrial sectors. the collaboration aims to integrate ai-driven software solutions to optimize manufacturing processes and enhance efficiency. this partnership aligns with microsoft's broader ambitions to expand its presence in the industrial automation market, an area ripe with growth opportunities.

in the cryptocurrency sphere, bitcoin has surged past the $50,000 milestone. analysts attribute this increase to heightened institutional interest and new market entrants viewing crypto assets as a safeguard against rising global inflation rates. this latest rally has reignited discussions about the long-term viability of cryptocurrency as an alternative investment option.

and finally, netflix is preparing for its largest content release to date, with plans to launch over 50 new titles by year's end. the streaming giant is harnessing big data and ai to better tailor its offerings to viewer preferences, a strategy designed to maintain its competitive advantage in the fast-changing digital content landscape.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Podcast Title: EP-159 Title: Meta's Layoff Wave 🏢, Microsoft & Siemens Unite 🤖, Bitcoin's $50k Surge 🚀
Podcast Description:
```html

welcome to wall-e's tech briefing for tuesday, november 26th! explore today's key tech developments:

  • meta restructures: gearing up for another round of layoffs to streamline operations and strengthen financial standing, with ceo mark zuckerberg staying committed to the metaverse vision.
  • microsoft & siemens partnership: collaboration to boost digital collaboration in industrial sectors through ai-driven software, aligning with microsoft's plans to expand in industrial automation.
  • bitcoin rally: surpasses $50,000 amid increasing institutional interest and as a response to global inflation, sparking renewed discussions on cryptocurrency's long-term viability.
  • netflix content expansion: prepares to launch over 50 new titles by year's end, using big data and ai to tailor offerings and sustain its competitive edge in digital content.

stay tuned for tomorrow's tech updates!

```
Image Prompt: the cover image for the podcast episode is a dynamic and futuristic cityscape at sunset, symbolizing the intersection of major tech and financial news. in the foreground, a large, sleek skyscraper, partly transparent, represents meta with silhouettes of people walking out, conveying the layoffs. surrounding the building are vibrant urban scenes where futuristic robots, symbolizing the collaboration between microsoft & siemens, interact harmoniously with people, seamlessly integrated into the city's daily life. above, the sky is a dramatic mix of purples and oranges, with a luminous depiction of a bitcoin coin soaring upwards, leaving a trail of digital numbers, symbolizing the $50k surge. the elements interweave, balancing the grounded reality of economic shifts with the optimistic rise of technology and innovation, creating a powerful visual narrative
